page.title: 02SHIPDHAM AIRFIELD
page.content: {Shipdham airfield}was used during the second world war by an American bomber squadron flying Liberators. Now there is a large industrial estate based around the wartime buildings. Most of the airfield is now farmland,a mixture of grazing for{Grange Farm's}herd of Fresian cows and cereal crops.There is also rough grass around the runways used by{Norfolk Beagles}for Hare hunts.{Arrow Air Services}is based on the airfield and two of the runways are still in service, used by a large variety of aircraft which come into the airfield for servicing, refuelling, crop spraying, pleasure flights or renovation. In total the airfield covers 28 acres. It is a green belt area. The industry and leisure facilities there are important to the whole county, not just Shipdham.
